description:
TLDR; so many rish and smooth flavors you can't go wrong

--

Your bones feel voluminous as if they may burst from pressure and the pain as if thousands of microscopic carnivorous rabbits eating the meat behind your eyeballs sends you into a slight shock. 

You're lying face down on a bustling sidewalk and vomit out a foamy broth. You see the metallic pellet that is your temporal transponder puked out in the muck and instinctually pop it back in your mouth and hard swallow. 

 Time jumps are never fun. 

You stand up, bit disoriented still, wipe your mouth, and look around. The rivers of people passing by don't give you a second look. 

In your world, Ukrainian militarized dolphins that came through The Chasm and partied on spring break and enslaved the vast majority of humankind through advanced interstellar-technology and military strategy, have taken over the world. 

https://bit.ly/2rJgGQT

You've time jumped to the not so distant past to convince Jeremy Wade, master fisherman and star of Animal Planet's acclaimed show, River Monsters, to help you catch and kill Rick the Dolphin, who will eventually become the dolphin's Supreme Leader. 

You take a quick look around and see people everywhere. People. Just living their lives and all walking down the street. 

You know you are on a tight timeframe but you see a Ben, Jerry, and Frank's and you can't remember the last time you had ice cream or if you'll ever have the chance to delight in some again. A quick stop won't hurt you think. 

You walk into the Ben, Jerry, and Frank's and look at the flavors. 

'Porpoise-fully Chocolate'
'Dare to Dolphin-ish the Pint Vanilla'
'Rotten Sex Moose'

Looking at the names of the flavors raises the alarm hairs on the back of your neck. Something is off. What's wrong with this Ben, Jerry and Frank's.

Then it hits you.

"Who the #$%& is Frank?" you think. "There's not supposed to be a Frank. THERE'S NOT SUPPOSED TO BE A FRANK!"

That's when you notice the shock collars around the necks of the visibly malnourished teenagers behind the counter. And the people walking down the street being poked with electric prods by the dolphins behind them. 

It's been theorized that opening a time portal could also slit an entry into a parallel universe and you just became firsthand witness to that truth.
 
If this is no longer your world then do you still have your mission?

You slice the heads off the teenagers with your SpecterBlade to put them out of their misery and go behind the counter and eat handful scoops of 'Porpoise-fully Chocolate.' 

The nano-tech combat suit you forgot you were wearing sparks back to life. They don't do well with time jumps. 

The wetware port on the base of your skull warms slowly and your consciousness expands to become one with the suit. 

You look at the Ben, Jerry and Frank's logo painted on the back wall - Frank the Dolphin with a smug grin holding the decapitated heads of Ben and Jerry - and decided dimension be damned. You're gonna bring the pain. 

"God and the Devil may both reside in my soul," you say to yourself.  "One lives an apathetic life of leisure in paradise. The other exists in abject horror to make sure someone pays for the wrong they've done."

Take another handful of 'Porpoise-fully Chocolate.'

"These dolphins won't have to guess hard which one has my ear."
author: Dave G.

description:
Wham, bam, thank you ice cream scooper! 

I came in here on a very cold day of shopping for some half baked ice cream. The service was quick and friendly and I was in and out in less then 5 minutes! 

I got a sugar cone with their name of half baked ice cream, they pile it on pretty good! There was a solid 2 and half scoops of sugary goodness on my cone that I was not gonna complain about. They have different options for cones and bowls including waffle bowls and cones with chocolate, cones without chocolate, so you can really make it your own.
author: Nicole K.

description:
It wasn't good. At all. Ben & Jerry's should do a quality control audit on this place. 

I get better tasting ice-cream from 7-11...for a lot cheaper. 

I love my artisanal hipster ice creams...but I wasn't expecting anything spectacular because it's just B & J. 

But come on it has to be at least good. I chose a flavor that didn't look covered in ice crystals. But still my milkshake was abysmal. 

There's a window-side bar stools. That was nice. 

The staff was very nice. That was nice too. 

But I can't recommend anyone give away their money for subpar frozen treats. I will however recommend you go to 7-11. They have better tasting 7-11 brand ice cream. But if you insist, their Ben & Jerry's selection isn't bad either. Obviously it depends on which location you visit.
author: Mechell G.

description: Yay for pumpkin cheesecake, was really good! Nice to see them still around despite the onslaught of the high end artisan ice cream and froyo stores that seem to be popping up everywhere.
author: Sunil R.

description: The Ice cream here isn't the greatest selection but the neighborhood is iconic. Stopped in for a picture, some cherry Garcia ,and a stroll through one of the most interesting places I've ever stepped foot in. Cool time
author: James F.

description: Paid like $5.50 for an extra small ice cream which is whack because I could've bought a pint for about that much at Safeway, but I love the location, the staff and the fact that they have a couple of almond milk ice cream flavors that aren't in stores yet!
author: Margaret D.

description:
It's ice cream. It's exactly like the Ben & Jerry's they sell in pint containers at your grocery store. The only difference is that here they scoop it into a cone or dish for you and sell it at a premium price ($7 for 6 ounces of ice cream).

My wife and daughter love the Chocolate Fudge Brownie and, being a huge fan of all things salted caramel, I liked the Salted Caramel Blondie.

Service was very friendly. It's right on the corner of Haight and Ashbury, so it's sort of a touristy iconic location to enjoy a treat.

They have vegan ice cream which, by the way, is not ice cream as it is missing the primary ingredient... cream.
author: Chad K.

description: Cherry Garcia is my favorite. This is a great traditional ice cream parlor and the place is really nice
author: Lisa C.

description:
The ice cream is delicious. The flavors have silly names. The fudge-dipped cone is awesome. Thanks for bringing Ben & Jerry's all the way from Vermont to this awesome corner shop.

I'm a happy girl when I have some...

Coffee, Coffee BuzzBuzzBuzz - coffee ice cream with coffee beans & chunks of fudge. Yummy!

or

Hazed & Confused - hazelnuts & swirls of fudge, also yummy!

It's a small shop, good for ordering on the go on a sunny day. There are a few seats along the window. Service is A-ok. Pretty expensive though, ~$5 for a small cup or cone.
author: Joy W.

description: How could you not love having a little piece of "Vermont's Finest" smack dab in the heart of the Haight? The ice cream here is pretty tasty, but can get very pricey, especially if you order items like  milkshakes and sundaes. I like that they have a large variety of waffle cones and bowls for sale, and that they allow you to mix as many flavors into your milkshake as you would like. The workers here are very friendly and are always more than patient when waiting for customers to order or when sampling out flavors.
author: Joseph A.

description: I live up the street and have been here a few times. Love this spot! The staff are super nice and if I ever just want to try a new flavour, they're always happy to let me sample and take my time. It can get super busy with the tourists butttt we are in the Haight so it's expected. My favorite flavour is the Tonight Dough or the Cherry Garcia. Nom nom. Also, keep a lookout for the free ice cream days and come early as the line is usually super long.
author: Mira B.

description:
When I'm in the area, I try to get some ice cream, mostly because it's my addiction. Ben & Jerry's has never done me wrong, but the last couple of times I've been, it's been only because I like the ice cream and nothing else. PLUS it's nice to bring ice cream to friends that work in the area!

The last time I was there, there were transients in the line, which I have no problem with. The problem I had was that they were cutting the line and stealing the ice cream cones. I was surprised that this happened, but what made it worse was that the person working did NOTHING. By the end of it, you had a bunch of confused customers and missing cones.

Food: 8/10
Staff: 7/10
Atmosphere: 6/10
Value: 8/10
Overall: 7.25/10
author: Evan K.

description: Josh is the man ... elbows to him .. he was very nice &friendly... we had the salted Caramel Blondie and it was the bomb diggy fresh ... like omg is in love! And my husband had the chunky monkey and cherry gracia mixed ... our experience here was excellent!! Thanks Josh
author: E B.

description:
Oh Ben and Jerry...how far you have traveled from Vermont. But with a ice cream named Cherry Garcia...what would you expect?

Nice location in the alternative Fisherman's wharf ..in  all senses of the word.

Great selection of cones and ice creams.

Service is okay if not stoned...what would you expect?

So top off your visit to the haight and have a scoop or two!
author: David G.

description: Went to grab a milkshake at 9:15pm on a Friday night, and they were closed 45min. early. They don't have hours posted on their windows or doors to almost allow for the ability to open and close when they please. There was an employee inside who we tried to get an explanation for their early close, and he was very unfriendly. If your hours on websites are posted, please do your due diligence to ensure you follow them, or update them.
author: Brianna S.

description:
I ordered a cake for my daughters birthday and I asked it to be a little lively and a bit of color. They told me they can't do purple or pink and I said okay then red if possible. They didn't follow my instructions. It was the worse decision ever. This is the last time I ever spend so much $$ on a overly priced birthday cake. 6 years I ordered from them and I had a much better experience, with the cake they even were able to make a Elmo and a design. Honestly really upset with this, I'm better off getting a Safeway cake.

Ps. After the cake was cut, as good as I remember it to be! The taste was wonderful but i wish presentation was as good as well.
author: Jennifer R.

description:
Dont get me wrong, I am a real fan of "Cherry Garcia," but $7.50 for a single scoop in a cone is expensive. It is nearly double the price of Mitchell's for a single scoop in a waffle cone and a quart of Ben & Jerry's at the market is less than $5. Convenience certainly dosnt come cheap in the Haight.
.
Located in the heart of the Haight, Ben & Jerry's serves up their signature Ice Creams in a variety of cups or cones. The servers are very helpful, patient and polite. I was offered sample tastes with out even asking for one.
.
Limited inside seated is available if you wish to avoid the sun.
author: Caesar A.

description: We stopped in after taking our photo just outside (obligatory H&A photo) to commemorate our visit to Hashbury.  This Ben & Jerry's is super cool, and we had some Phish Food and Cherry Garcia ice cream to celebrate.  The staff here was very friendly, and made small talk about where we were from as he scooped and scooped.  The location is iconic, and the ice cream was delicious.
author: John T.

description:
Someone thought they had mad skillz to make me a birthday cake and at the last minute came crying to me and apologizing for not coming through.

I told her it was okay because other than a good strawberry shortcake, I love a good ice cream cake or pie. One of my biggest beefs about San Francisco is that all the good parlors and such cater to the "big kids".  Rents have gotten so high that the classic Baskin Robbins stores are gone.

As I don't like the ones they make at Safeway, we went to Ben & Jerry's.  They usually need 48 hours notice for a custom cake (they have to keep it super cold as they put it together), but fortunately they have a fridge stocked with cakes they've made in the past few days!  They had a selection of about 15 and I chose the Americone Dream cake which afforded us sizable slices.  The two flavors were Americone Dream and Milk and Cookies sandwiched with their homemade brownie crust and decorated with whipped cream icing and chocolate and caramel drizzle!  Loved it!  There is no other place to get a custom made ice cream cake like this in the city for kids or big kids.  If you order in advance they can write on it.

I could complain about prices but with high costs of staff and rents in SF, I'm happy to have an ice cream shop that isnt far off the beaten path
author: Erik H.

description: The waffle cones aren't the only thing that's freshly baked at this place.
author: Arculano S.

description: The only reason I'm giving 2 stars is because the cake was good. I ordered a cake for a company party on Wednesday I was told the cake would be ready to pick up by 10:00 am Friday. When I arrived  to pick up the cake I was told my cake wasn't going to be ready until 11:00am, which wasn't going to work because the party started at 11:00. Anyway I talked to the lady who was making the cake and she kept telling me my pick up time was at 11:00 and the cake wasn't ready yet. I told her I wouldn't agree to that time because the party starts at 11:00 but whatever, she told me she could finish the cake in 15 minutes. The cake I received was the most hideous thing I ever laid eyes on! I'm so disappointed in Ben and Jerry's and if it wasn't a cake for my company I would have refused to accept the cake and demanded a refund!
author: Terriana B.

description:
After a day spent shopping around Haight with some friends, we decided to end it with a cup of ice cream. 

I've always loved Ben & Jerry's ice cream. It's very delicious and I buy pints for myself whenever I feel like I deserve it. This is a nice little shop, but it is admittedly over priced per serving which is why I avoid going there.

The times I do go there, I try to get the flavors that are not sold in stores or are 'test batches.' I glanced around and I saw the Schweddy Balls flavor and it killed me so I HAD to get it. Whoever doesn't get that reference needs to watch SNL more.

Anyway, the flavor of the ice cream itself seemed promising. Vanilla ice cream with rum flavor and rum balls/malt balls tossed inside. Actual ice cream tasted good but rum balls were mushy/interesting but not my thing. I liked the malt balls though.

I got the small size which is $4.75. 

Worth going to if you only get the shop only flavors!
author: Sofia R.

description: I decided to purchase something regardless of the fact that I could've waited 3 hours and get free ice cream at my job. I got a scoop of brownie batter in a waffle and it was like $8, the ice cream was too sweet. I asked if they made their ice cream there or got it shipped, if anyone cares it was shipped. I could've take a trip to Safeway and paid the same price for a lot more ice cream :(
author: Cristina M.

description:
Vegan ice cream!!!! PB & Cookies, Chunky Monkey, Coffee Caramel Fudge, and Chocolate Fudge Brownie.

Divine
author: Greg R.

description:
What's up with the pint prices? Prepacked pint is $7.25. Handpacked is $6.25. If you go to Whole Foods, down the street, a pint  is only $5.49. 

They have the classics: cherry garcia, phish food, chubby hubby..

If you are in the mood for chocolate and nuts try-  NY super fudge chunk
author: Teresa S.

description: It was a crowded place on a Saturday afternoon, but the staff was friendly and moved things along. And who doesn't love Ben & Jerry's?! Cool neighborhood too!
author: Nicole D.

description: It's Ben and Jerry's on Haight/Ashbury.  Need I say more?  Go get some...
author: Josiah B.

description: Bf got the vegan PB & cookies, and couldn't even tell it was made with almond milk, until I told him. I predict there will be pints in my house, in the future. Anyway, the line moved quickly and there were yummy flavors. What I really liked was how the male server was extra patient with a little boy and he added the toppings exactly the way the boy wanted. It was really nice.
author: Jessica S.

description:
I only got water here, so I can't say much about the experience, hehe.  The inside was clean and the cashier was cool.  I'm sure the ice cream is consistently good at all locations.

It was cool to hang out on Haight, as I have never done that until last month.
author: Winston S.

description:
How long will a girl wait in line for two scoops of cookies and cream ice cream in a waffle cone on a Saturday afternoon? And How much will she pay?

Well, if it's Chandra D aka me, then the answer is 25 minutes and $9.75.

SAY WHAT! Yeah, ya'll....ridiculous, but I REALLY had a craving for some ice cream. I was stomping around the Haight visiting my favorite thrift/vintage stores and had a hankering for some ice cream, so I stepped in to Ben and Jerry's. 

The two employees were nice, but so doggone slow! I get it! You like to chat with your customers, but c'mon! When the line is out the door now is NOT the time to discuss how you're from Boston, and you hate the Yankees, and you'd rather see the Yankees lose more than you want the Sox to win, and you're sorry you missed out on scoring tickets to The Outside Lands festival. Good lord, man! 

I was also a little grossed out by the frozen fruits they had. They looked like they had freezer burn and some of the raspberries looked like poop. Yuck.

Anyway, the ice cream was okay, but way too expensive!
author: Chandra D.

description: Extremely overpriced.  $8.25 for one scoop of ice cream with some whipped cream and cookie underneath.  Ridiculous.  Sounds like the socialist owners have fully embraced capitalism only when it comes to prices at their shop.
author: Megan K.

description: Being a tourist for the day with my lady and our "kids." Always great ice cream from Ben and Jerrys but the staff is great too! Great for a midday snack if you're checking out the area. Go Go Go is what i say! If you've never been, Cherry Garcia is my favorite. If you need a sugar fix, get it here...
author: Josh C.

description: Bought two cups and one cone and it was $21.00! Walked out and discovered our ice cream was awful! We had cookie dough and it was crumbling. Like crumbs! Not the dough but the actual ice cream. And it tasted bad. We didn't go back because we already walked away but we al threw our ice cream away. Total waste of money and really disappointed that they would serve such rancid tasting ice cream.
author: Sandy C.

description:
I'm such a huge fan of ice cream, especially Ben and Jerry's. But sometimes my stomach can't handle the dairy. Fortunately for me, Ben and Jerry's had a lot of variety including non-dairy drinks.  I opted for the mango pineapple drink which was delicious!  The employees here were very friendly and helpful in finding me a drink that I would like.  The store accepts credit cards as well which is always a plus. Parking in the area can be difficult though, but if you are lucky enough to find one, stop on in here!

FYI, they wont allow you to use their restroom (I already asked) but there was a park two blocks down the block on Oak Street that is open to the public and rather clean.
author: Janet E.

description:
This place is great for its nostalgia, and the fact that it's right on the corner of Haight and Ashbury. Historical art abounds fills the walls, giving it a very eclectic and old-San-Francisco feel. I would definitely go again to take more pictures of all the neat and quirky things they have on display. The people are nice, and I love that they are as funky as the shop is. They operate at normal speed though, which was not very helpful when the line got long.

3 stars because the ice cream itself is pricey, even if it is one flavor and without toppings. Also, there is a window counter with like 3-4 stools for seating. My friend hurt his ankle and so it was important for us to sit and eat our ice cream, and it became difficult when the line got long and the shop filled with people. There was no personal space, and I had to be careful that someone didn't accidentally push his elbow into my ice cream cone. Maybe next time, I'll buy a Ben and Jerrys carton from a grocery store and then just eat it at the corner while I look into the shop for all their cool artwork.
author: Ashley G.

description: Getting a Cherry Garcia on the corner of Haight and Ashberry. That is about as iconic as it can get. It is still alive from the 70's and the people there are still living it. History was written here and  now you can have an ice cream and watch the world go by. to much fun and way to many memories. Were you there? I was.
author: Charley C.

description:
Walked up for a photo infront of the Dead house on Ashbury then had the munchies....

Yum for B and J.

Wasn't here last time through town :)
author: Michael B.

description: Ben & Jerry's ice cream by itself is really great. Ben & Jerry's in San Fran during summertime was really really great (:
author: Sabrina R.

description: Waste of money! We got two cups of ice cream, one was supposed to be small, the guy made it a large. Both cookie dough, it was old and freezer burnt, the ice cream crumbled, it was dry and gross tasting. We also got a waffle cone and it came out to $21.00. I could get a gallon of Dryers for $5 that isn't old and crumbly. I should have got my money back but was too lazy to walk back. I will never come here again!
author: Carrie C.

description: Super nice guys working there. This place seems always busy. Nice variety of B&J's classic flavors as well as a few less known/ new flavors. I just wish there was more variety of the flavors we usually don't see in the grocery stores, especially when it costs a tiny bit more to get it here. There's a few seats to sit behind the front shop's window, but don't count on it as it will most likely be taken. They even got brownies and cookies that I wanted so much to buy, but death-by-sugar is not that way I want to go out, but they did look very tasty!
author: Paeng M.

description:
Came in earlier armed with a Groupon and the intent to use it on a birthday cake for my brother.  While I was trying -really- hard to be nice while in the store, my interactions with "the cake guy" left me confounded afterward....upon locating the cake I inquired about, he said that he easily identified me as a Groupon user.  He just knew so based upon catching sight of me, but didn't care to explain further.  Really? Cause I'm curious.  Was it my ethnicity? Or what I was wearing? Maybe I'm not hipster enough for the Haight...or do I just look cheap? Didn't ask, but I'm sure it was negative. 

He then told me he couldn't write happy birthday on the cake since that was for custom orders and other times when he felt like it.  And that I needed to get back in line to pay, since he had to be fair to others.  Thanks, but wasn't planning on cutting the line anyway.

The cashier was nice, hence the three star rating.  But I don't get it...yes,  I'm a groupon user, as if half of San Francisco.  If your business wants to treat it's coupon using customers like second class citizens, then maybe you shouldn't sign yourselves up for the site in the first place?
author: Joanne G.

description:
Sweddy balls anyone? lol 

We came in here to try it. Good thing they offer small samples prior to ordering a full cup. That sweddy balls flavor was ok. If you are into rum then maybe its for you. I did samples of other flavors and ended up with the Late Night Snack. This flavor has potato chips in it. It was on hit. Thanks friendly associate. But for $4.75 a small scoop i only can come here when I have extra dollars in my pocket. The 1 pint in the freezer is only a $1.25 more with almost quadruple size the amount of ice cream. Ben and Jerry's ice cream is more packed in filling than the small mom and pop brands[Joe's and mitchells] that sell a single scoop for about $3. You wont find the traditional, plain flavors out here. Pretty similar to a coldstone creamery but these are all premixed in the bucket.
author: Jeff C.

description: I visited the store for the first time by the end of the day today and was surprised, besides the not friendly service, that even though we spent $20 in 3 single scoops cones there were no water available for customers. Such poor customer service.
author: Mariane S.

description:
This place is awesome.  If you don't live in the Haight, it's worth a trip to the Haight.  They have flavors that are not sold in grocery stores.  Plus all of their ice cream is super fresh.  You can buy hand-packed pints, and even split it with 2 flavors at no extra charge.  OMG.   My favorite is the banana peanut better frozen yogurt with chocolate peanut butter.  But then they have sea salted caramel that is great.  They have many many flavors-- everything is outstanding.  And they even have these awesome coupons that you can ask for: Buy 2 pints, get one free.  SO, have one of these coupons and make a trip to The Haight and stock up on your ice cream.  But I hope you have some self-control, because that "stock up" won't last the weekend.   

Oh, and the staff are SUPER FRIENDLY as well.  Great experience!!  Even for me, who is usually a vegan, but sometimes falls off the wagon during times of high stress or when in PMS-crisis mode.
author: Lori B.

description: Just like any other ice cream place but with Ben and Jerry's flavors. We got two double scoop ice cream cones and one small smoothie and paid $28. Very good ice cream, decent service, but just way too pricey.
author: Steph D.

description:
I love ice cream but way too pricey for 2 little scoops. $5.75. Pints $6. Go to Safeway and buy a pint for $4.50. 

I know I sound cheap but I'm not. $4.25 would be nearly o.k. I'd just been to crap/crepe express next door and had a worse experience there so I guess I might just be a whining grumpy ..... something.
author: Seamus M.

description:
[M]ona: 3 Stars
[W]ayne: 3.5 Stars
Average: 3.25 Stars

+ Accepts Credit Cards
+ Good Ice Cream
+ Lots of Variety
+ Extensive Menu

- Hard to find Parking
- Expensive

[W] This is one of the few Ben and Jerrys left in San Francisco. I swear we are getting taken over by all these Frozen Yogurt aka "Froyo" spots in the city. What ever happened to just good old ice cream anymore? I remember when they use to have a large location near my grandparents house in the North Beach district and they would hold a one day only all you can eat ice cream once a year. My childhood memories were eating roughly around 22 cones in one day.....NO LIE!! Anyways today we came here because Mona had a coupon that she wanted to redeem. We ended up getting 4 pints of ice cream plus a smoothie and a orange gatorade haha. Yea yea, I got a gatorade so what?? Stop the HATERADE oHHhhH........(yes very tacky). Anyways this place is usually pretty busy since it's in the heart of the Haight/Ashbury neighborhood.

I feel kind of bad and at the same time not too bad neither because while we were waiting in line, there was a girl in front of us that was totally skipped. I guess the guy behind the counter thought she had already ordered and I though so too until she said "he just skipped me." Well lady, don't tell me, tell him!! Haha. Too bad so sad, should've spoke up so they could hear you! I just felt bad because she just walked her little self to the back of the line so they could see her. If that was me, I would've just caught one of the guys attention. I mean, I was holding 4 friggin pints of ice cream [http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VAyb61CscwPslmFYZvR7Sg?select=9PiV0vkHk-xLlMaOD8IlYQ] and wanting to order more. Who do they really want to service first? Haha....... man i'm going straight to hell lol.

Anyways, today we got the "Imagine Whirled Peace", "Milk and Cookies", "Mint Chocolate Cookie" and "Magic Brownies"...can you say ew? lol. Well we just took everything home before it all melted. I really enjoyed the Milk and Cookies ice cream. It had a healthy serving of cookies in there. The flavor was sweet and yummy. It was also the same for the Mint Chocolate Cookie as well but I think I preferred the Milk and Cookies better. I tried a little bit of the Magic Brownies that gave me Magic Brownies in the bathroom lol i'm jk. It was basically blackberries with sweet cream ice cream and brownies. The flavors in my opinion didn't fit my palate so i'll leave that for Mona to finish. We have yet to open up the Imagine Whirled Peace but Mona tells me that it's her favorite so maybe we'll review that later on.

Overall parking here is horrible and luckily again I had the Miata and was lucky enough to just circle the block once until I spotted a guy coming out of his parking spot and I quickly jumped on it. It's great to come here and get a nice little cone on a hot day to refresh yourself and enjoy all the little independent shops here. The Haight/Ashbury is famous for this plus all their tattoo parlors and diverse population within this community. Check this place out if your playing the tourist roll or even if you're locals =P
author: Mona C.

description: This could be a regular Ben & Jerrys but it is right on the corner of Haight and Ashbury so even though the Vermont ice cream power house have been sold to an international conglomerate, this one keep a little bit of the counter-culture spirit. Plus, it was a black away from our former flat and it brings back great memories!
author: Stéphanie S.

description:
Desperate for ice cream and walking around the Haight, CP and I were lured into Ben & Jerry's by the smell of their waffle cones. While I'm comfortable (even enthusiastic) with Ben and Jerry's ice cream in pint form from the market the idea of being in SF and not getting some truly remarkable scoops was sad. But I needed my ice cream fix and I needed it now!!!

So Ben and Jerry's wins. The shop is cute. It's the standard good stuff. I enjoyed the shop only flavor of coconut seven layer bar. Mix that with one of my favorite, bonaroo buzz, and you have a stupendous cone experience. I was jazzed. CP was too. We enjoyed.
author: Tai F.

description: Service was okay...this ice cream is extremely over priced. I had a small greet vanilla yogurt and it was about $6 with no toppings or add ins.
author: Chloé E.

description:
I have to give this place at least three stars because let's be honest, their ice cream is really, really good.

I live about two blocks away and stop by occasionally when I'm totally seduced by the smell of the waffle cones flooding a normally slightly stinky Haight Street. However, this place is EXTREMELY overpriced and flooded with tourists lusting after the fake Haight/Ashbury signs outside. The staff is rude about 50% of the time, but I imagine I'd get pissy too dealing with the tourist trap that is their intersection.

Good ice cream. Too expensive. Too much 'tude.
author: Courtney A.

description: I mean, come on. Get a waffle cone and 2 scoops. You will thank yourself later.
author: Leland B.

description:
I will always have a wealth of appreciation for Ben and Jerry's. Especially this location, for a variety of reasons:

1.) Jerry went to Oberlin. (http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-177912901.html) Nough said.
2.) I love all of the artwork associated with Ben and Jerry's.
3.) The tipping bell here is genius. Though I've seen many a shy server blush as some lame-o throws in a nickel - and they have to ring the darn bell in order to acknowledge the gesture.
4.) Waffle cones.
5.) Thick, can barely make it up the straw -  shakes
6)  Unreal moist brownie sundaes, topped with smooth chocolate syrup.
7.) Creative ice-cream flavor names.
8.) The leisurely walk down Haight street with my melting mound of frozen milk glory (familiar Haight smells go nicely with ice-cream) 
9.) Cherry Garcia Ice-cream.
10.) Even better - Cherry Garcia Frozen Yogurt.

Trust.

(http://www.yelp.com/events/san-francisco-free-cone-day---ben-and-jerrys---tues-4-21-09-12-8pm)
author: Jessica T.

description: Just your average ice cream shop. I got the banana peanut butter greek yogurt and milk and cookies ice cream on a waffle cone. Man, the smell of the waffles definitely oversold it. The minute you walk into the store, you're just intoxicated with the scent of the waffle cones being made. It smells so fresh and delicious. The cones go pretty quick so beware. The peanut butter greek yogurt didn't taste like yogurt, it really tasted more like ice cream. The banana flavor wasn't strong enough, there was a good amount of peanut butter though. The milk and cookies ice cream was alright, it had bits of cookies in there. There's definitely better ice cream shops in SF but Ben & Jerry's isn't too bad, I'd say only come here if you have a coupon though. It's kind of pricey and it isn't the best there is..
author: Virginia Y.

description: I really wasn't expecting (though it makes compete sense) to see a Ben and Jerry's while walking down Haight. Having been recently denied a waffle cone cup in Philly, I had to stop in to get a fix. Everything looked right: the waffle was indeed in cup shape, dipped in chocolate then rainbow sprinkles. One scoop of chunky monkey and I was good to go. Went for the chunky monkey first and it was just like I remembered. The waffle cone, however, was stale!! I couldn't believe it! After a second bite, I also realized that I think it was chocolate (I don't even know if chocolate waffle cones exist but I hope to dear god they do or else the cone was REALLY bad). I told some other friends about it and they agreed that this location was especially bad. I wish that weren't the case because it would've been a nice break after a long walk :/
author: Amanda C.

description: Ben and Jerry's has always had really good ice cream and sundaes. The Vermonster is a, try it once with friends, must.
author: Michael S.

description: Came here with my boyfriend i bought a 6.25 worth of ice cream. I gave the guy 20 dollar and he gave me back 4 dollar change. And he immediately rush to the back. But i waited for him to give me back the right amount of change. Overall the ice cream was good. Just make sure to count  the change you get back.
author: Annie G.

description: I'm pretty much obsessed with the Greek Frozen Yogurt. My absolute favorite is the Peanut Butter Banana flavor, however they are all fenomin
author: Daniella M.

description:
This is my favorite ice cream chain by far and this particular shop carries the usual, but at hiked up prices. Yes, you can by most of the flavors from your grocer's freezer, but chances are they won't serve it out of a freshly made waffle cone or bowl with the right blend of crisp softness. 

I only ever have strawberry cheesecake ice cream from here and it never fails.  This last visit was no different. 

Overall, cute shop, great location, friendly service and a tasty treat to take on your walk down Haight. Just be prepared to pay a pretty penny.
author: Lynn D.

description:
OK- don't be fooled. I love Ben & Jerry's ice cream.  So many of their flavors are delicious, and I love all the unique combinations. You generally have to take the pint away from me for me to stop. So going to the store and just grabbing a scoop seemed like a great idea.

But I cannot rate this particular joint highly. And this is why:

1) When I called to know when they were closing, the staff acted really annoyed and bothered. Not sure why. Also she gave me a different time (an hour earlier) than the website, so when I called back to verify, she says "ya i guess we're open until then." Yo, what's with the 'tude?

2) When we get there, the staff looked like they wanted to commit suicide.  Not to mention that they let out a HUGE sigh upon us entering. Really?? You're open for another 2 hours. You get paid to be here and I'm not asking for anything unreasonable!

3) Um... $4.25 for a small scoop? Um.. I think not. Sorry, but I can walk my fat a$$ to Lucky's and pay that much for an entire pint. 

Sorry, Ben & Jerry's on Ash/Haight. You look cute, but your inside made me want to scream (not for ice cream!). Haha.
author: Roxane W.

description:
I never really go to places like this in L.A. because, 1.) I don't need the extra poundage, and 2.) The lines are normally long.

Well, being that I was on a mini-vacation with my friends (fellow Yelpers), who am I to rain on the parade of eating/trying out new places? When in Rome (or S.F.), why not, right?

So, after walking around the Haight area, I needed something to cool me down, refresh me from all the walking. Being from Southern California, I hardly walk, so, it was nice to do so and just take in the experience. S.F. reminds me a lot like NYC because of all the trekking you do on foot.

The store was empty (besides us, maybe because it was a Sunday morning?) So, I decided on a smoothie (Island something, had mango, and sherbert) and it sure quenched my thirst. Especially after all that walking, it was a nice refreshing drink. Was it healthy? Was it really good that I basically packed in more calories? Who cares! It was good and got the job done. 

I can't wait to try other things on the menu down here now. Well, maybe I'll go for a nice long walk before heading to Ben & Jerry's and hopefully the lines are not that bad.
author: Wes S.

description: Do I even need to write something? The smell of the waffle cones is what lures you in. Shame they haven't condensed that into ice cream form. Yum yum.
author: Heather R.

description:
Ben & Jerry's on Haight&Ashbury.

How can this place not be good?
author: Ayall S.

description: Passing through the hippie part of town, I was excited to see a Ben & Jerrys. I grabbed their chocolate dipped waffle cone with a heavenly fudge ice cream and a scoop of phish food and I was in sheer bliss. Love this place!!
author: Sasan J.

description:
Good ice cream?  Yes.
Tourist trap?  Yes.

Normally, I wouldn't waste my time reviewing an outpost of a national chain.  Yet, some locations have something about them that requires a deeper look, especially to understand why I rounded up from 3.5 stars...

Why did we venture in?  It's the freakin' corner of Haight-Ashbury!  Thought I might see Jerry Garcia (RIP) whipping up a pint of his special just for me.  Simply, it's cool.  And B&J has pretty good ice cream.

The bad?  Well, this was certainly the most expensive ice cream on our trip --- and anywhere I've ever been!  Forget high rent, for about $5 I can get anything from 3 small scoops to a pint's worth of quality scream anywhere in SF or LA.  Here, I get one scoop.

And the servers... is being stoned a prerequisite?  Tried ordering a double and, uh, let's just say that didn't work out.  Free scoop w/ purchase of tee shirt?  Sweet!  Oh, you only have small sizes (and you do know I looove ice cream?).

In an attempt at redemption, I really enjoyed the coconut 7-layer bar, and the huge selection of "shop only" flavors was a bonus.  You can't even see the flavors at most of the shops I've been to.  So, as a vacation treat or once-in-a-while thing, it's worthy of 4 stars.  As a regular joint, it'd never last.
author: Alan S.

description:
i am an ICE-CREAM MANIAC. Ice-cream is my week-end food and if i don't have a chance to get my dose of Great Ice-cream - my new week starts from dissatisfaction (it's like to getting up on the wrong side of the bed)

Yesterday i hit Ben and Jerry's. Chunky-monkey and Coconut 7 layer in a waffle cone.  2 stars. It lacks smoothness and elegance of Humphrey Slocombe and Ciao Bella. Those chocolate chunks in chunky-monkey were humongous tasteless brown colored hunks. I mean there's no way of adding those hunks into an ice-cream. There's no way those hunks can smoothly melt in my mouth in collaboration with ice-cream. So i tried to gnaw them and since it didn't give me any pleasure i kindly asked for a little cup to get rid of this unnecessariness from my ice-cream. Which gave a chance to taste a banana flavor of that ice-cream. It was overflowing with sugar so if i didn't read the ice-cream description before - it would be hard to understand that that was actually banana flavor.
Coconut was ok, i mean nothing inspiring at all...
 
okay, i am raising my rating to 3 stars (service was nice).
Give it a try one more time with a hope to have more pleasing experience.
author: moa m.

description:
I don't even like ice cream and this place won my heart.

My friend was indecisive about his flavor and the owner literally let us try just about all flavors. SUPER nice guy. Ironically, after tasting and talking for fifteen minutes we left not buying a thing. 

Ice cream was meh (well OK no, it was amazing -I'm just lactose) but the owner and staff gets five stars for being rad.
author: Jessica A.

description: Chunky monkey and fuge shake was delicous! With great employees. And a clean environment. Could have bigger straws.
author: Brent N.

description: Flavors you won't find elsewhere. Fresh tasting. I am starting to crave some ice cream just thinking about this place. Love their peanut-butter chocolate milkshakes.  I was at the Ben & Jerry music festival in Golden Gate Park and they gave everyone some free ice cream, great company. Service is generally good but place can get busy. Ice cream here is pricey but you get what you pay for. Ice cream here just tastes better than most places.
author: Ron W.

description:
Three stars!

Ben and Jerry's is ALWAYS delicious and the dude working behind the counter was highly entertaining and was blaring hits from the 80s and 90s! 

But seriously..It's really over my head how they charge $4.25 for a tiny cup of ice cream that's like 8 bites when you can purchase a pint from the freezer section for $5.25.  Obvioulsy, I went with the pint.  That's still expensive.  I think pints are normally about $1 cheaper at your local corner market or Safeway.  More flavor options as well.

I then proceeded to enjoy almost 1/2 my pint of Everything But The... on the bus ride home!
author: Jenny W.

description:
y'know what? F*** this place!

If you walk along Haight St. to check out the local San Francisco scene, its all these independently owned cool shops. Then you get to the FAMOUS intersection of Haight-Ashbury and what do you get? The big ol' corporate store trying to make a dime by commercializing history. "Look at us, we are Ben & Jerry! We are hippies...well commercially-safe, bring mom, dad & the kids type hippies". Its kinda disgusting

Anyway, the franchise "Ben & Jerry's" ice cream shops suck anyway (those that are still open, those things were everywhere and closed faster than Quiznos stores). Its the same exact ice cream you can buy at the supermarket but cost more money and served in a bowl instead of a carton. The reason why other ice cream franchises are good is because you can't get their flavors at the local Safeway. 

So, because B&J ice cream shops were stupid ideas in the first place AND because this particular placement was made as a pandering commercialization of something thats suppose to be cool...i deem you ONE star! FACE!
author: Mike K.

description: Sucks! Yup, we ordered a birthday cake for my son, and had a gift card to pay for it.... we arrived and they refused to take a Ben & Jerrys gift card that THEY ISSUED! Way to ruin a little kids birthday guys! The shop is super dirty, the music is really really loud and the staff looks wasted. Well, what can I expect from these corporate sell outs!
author: Elizabeth M.

description: Hooray for Free Ice Cream cone day! They gave me a generous serving so I can't complain. Donations went to help SF Parks. There is nothing more you can ask for. My BF, however, got a rather skimpy serving. I guess they're having more free ice cream days at other locations this week. I really wish I could check them all out but I'll be huge if that were the case. I'll be back for more though because I have coupons.
author: Amy J.

description:
Cocon seven layer bar milkshake?? uh, hell yesssss!!

$6 thou for a 14oz ? kinda lame.. look for coupons on the toursit maps they help.

kid in the store was playing just about the worst music ever though..but the product good.
author: Augustine W.

description:
Came by early afternoon on a Sunday. It wasn't too crowded but the line moved fairly quickly. 

Ordered a plain vanilla milkshake and it much too watery than I would've liked. 

Ice-cream here is great but the milkshakes were nothing to write home about. Different quality, but a McDonalds milkshake may have had better consistency.
author: Susie L.

description:
Poppy hates the Haight and she hates hipsters and the only thing she hates more than hipster are tourists. 

Yet Poppy loves ice cream and was willing to put up with both tourists and hipsters in order to ingest 24 dollars worth of ice cream here today.

Service is slow that can't be helped.  Cost is high, what does one expect, the store is literally on the corner of Haight and Ashbury.

Chocolate and nut covered waffle cones are divine.  seven dollar drinks ridiculously decadent.  I do prefer elitist foodie ice cream to Ben and Jerry's but this is still a fun place to get your munchies on.
author: Poppy C.

description:
not much seating, crowded but a nice fun break from walking.
the location is probably the only special thing about this store, but it's still fun to visit any B&J. If you can get a seat at the bar by the window it's a nice place to people watch.
author: Teresa K.

description: $5.25 for a small. Also made the mistake of getting lemonade sorbet which pretty much tasted like Lysol. I'm sure the ice-cream would have been better but $5.25 is outrageous and actually make Bi-Rite seem reasonable. Is it just because it's a tourist trap? I live up the street and would like to bring my son here for an occasional ice cream cone but I won't because it's so damn overpriced.
author: Rachel P.

description:
i view groupons like pick up lines...they reel you in and get you interested in trying something new or visiting an old favorite. so, why the negativity about me coming in to "close" the deal? honestly, there are many more awesome, unique ice creameries in and out the city who enjoy my patronage without judgement.

what was maybe offensive to me was that i went in with my half-sister (if we didn't say, you'd never know we were related, as she has an african-american trait & hipster look, while i am clearly asian & preppy look) and upon entering, we were greeted with a, "let me guess, you have a groupon" because the day i came in, was the day it was expiring. so, naturally, i respond with, "wow, do we look like a grouponers?" "well, YOU do, but she doesn't"...alright then, i'd like my ice cream and be on my way the hell out of this judgemental corner of the haight!

anyway, the iconic ice cream is what it is (innovative), but the people chosen to represent it are nobodies going nowhere! i'd rather find my way to other extraordinary ice cream shops around the rest of the city who are also innovative and employ people who positively represent their company!
author: Marjie T.

description:
I have a hard time giving this place less then 5 stars, but just because the ice cream deserves 5 stars doesn't mean this place does. 

I went here for the first time since i was a kid a couple months ago. Granted i never went long without buying a pint at Safeway, the only other time I've gotten a scoop from an actual b&j's store was as a kid visiting family in new Hampshire. So my boyfriend and i both ordered the small cup and we both ordered 2 flavors. the cup was so overflowing with ice cream, the ice cream probably reached 2 inches higher then the cup was supposed to hold. 4.75 for each ice cream? OK, fine, they gave us our money's worth. 

TODAY..... my boyfriend and i go in with the same intentions. I say to the guy "you're allowed to get 2 flavors in the small scoop, right?" he tells me no. fine, whatever, i didn't like their selection today anyways. So i order my 7 layer coconut and my boyfriend gets his chocolate whatever. The ice cream didn't even touch the sides of the cup it was so small. is this the same size i ordered last time i came here? are you guys for fucking real? So i ate my $4.75 ice cream... very slowly... and enjoyed as much as possible, but i can't help but feel jipped. 

All in all, i will never return to that ice cream shop ever again. I can't say i will never eat b&j's again because that would be a flat out lie, but just because your ice cream is good, and their names are witty does not justify ripping me off.
author: A. H.

description:
As as avid foodie and Yelper, you must try to eat as much as you can and review it. (Not if this helps for those that are trying to lose weight).....
Upon having a delicious "peaceful" breakfast here on Haight and Ashbury, we walked around and came across a few cool stores and the sun was in full stride. Waiting for our taxi ride, We turn around and whala!  A Ben and Jerry's! Well, since I love my coffee ice cream, I had one scoop with the waffle bowl. Yummmmmm. Nothing fancy, just a plain ol scoop on a mid-sunday morning. Summertime, I can only imagine long lines here....

Enjoy.
author: Mike F.

description:
I'm writing this review on Ben & Jerry's since it is on the fabulous intersection of Haight & Ashbury, a world famous San Francisco destination.

The other day I had the flavor of Cake Batter.  Not sure if they sell this in the grocery store, but it was tasty with chocolate frosting swirl and yellow cake flavor.  Takes me back to my favorite Duncan Hines cake.

An ice cream store owned by 2 hippies is in the perfect spot in the Haight.  Love it!
author: Janet H.

description:
Long ago, I was a Scooperologist at the Ben & Jerry's on Columbus in North Beach and every day I'd have myself a large cup of Coffee Coffee Buzz Buzz Buzz.  Nowadays I head to the Haight-Ashbury store for my fix.  Sometime ask them to make a Vermonster for you: 30 scoops of ice cream, 4 brownies, two cookies, a fuckload of sprinkles, and a spoon.  That's more cow than a 32 oz. strip steak.

Bonus points for committing to hiring a staff of troubled youth to get 'em off the streets.  The guys who work there are really nice!
author: Mike O.

description:
I think this would make a wonderful talk thread topic- "What's your favorite Ben and Jerry's Ice Cream- and why???" the why part is what makes it even more personal- cuz lets face it- your first time with chunky monkey or cherry garcia and strawberry cheesecake- would probably pale in comparison to mine--- or maybe not...
Sooooo many flavors- sooooo many memories...g, pg-13, nc-17 or x --you'll be coming back for more ;-)

PS- You can buy me ice cream here ANYTIME (wink wink)
author: Arissa C.

description: When the hell did a small scoop become $4.75? I had no idea B&J was trying to compete with SF's artisinal scoop shops. At least I got to try a bunch of flavors so I'll know what to buy by the pint (when they're on sale of course).
author: Mimi L.

description:
I love birthdays! The free cone give-away was awesome! At first we walked by and decided to pass on it because the line was somewhat long.  But after grabbing a bite to eat over at Squat and Gobble, we decided to tough it out and wait in the line...hey, can't beat free ice cream on a cold SF night, right? To our surprise, the line moved rather quickly.  We probably waited no more than 15 minutes and we were able to satisfy our sweet tooth. 

The caramel chunk was ok.  I regret not going for the Coffee Coffee BuzzBuzzBuzz flavor that the lady ahead of us was raving about.
author: Lisa C.

description:
I live above a supermarket, so I'm much more likely to satisfy ice cream cravings by walking downstairs to get a pint or across the street for a Peace Pop.

I don't mind having a Ben & Jerry's on Haight and Ashbury. It certainly fits the neighborhood better than the Gap. It's not like the Upper Haight needs another head shop or used clothing store.

The waffle cones are tasty (but pricey - it's just ice cream). It gives the tourists someplace to go, and once or twice a year they have free ice cream day - that's reason enough for me.
author: Timothy O.

description: Up until a few days ago, I had never had Ben and Jerry's ice cream before. I kind of wish I didn't go here cause now I want some of their delicious chocolate chip cookie dough every day. It is pretty expensive but absolutely worth it.
author: Darius A.

description:
We all know that Ben & Jerry's ice cream is great, the neighborhood this parlor is in is a huge tourist trap and that everybody stops in here on a warm day for some inter-shopping refreshment.  But on a warm Saturday morning, before the crowds have arrived or late in the evening when all the tourists have gone home, it's nice to pop in for a scoop of your favorite flavor.

You just can't knock it.
author: Jonathan B.

description: Although Ben & Jerry's is a main stream ice cream provider, I will say that the get 4 stars in my book. Great flavors and awesome tasting ice cream.  Always creamy and I like the unique flavors with fancy names.  If you don't like Ben & Jerry's, you don't like ice cream.
author: Shad B.

description:
I liked this place a whole lot better when it was a partner scoop shop. Sad that they couldn't keep it open as that, but props to the new owner for hiring lots of the kids in the job training program, which was part of the store's previous state. 
Still, and though it's not the fault of the store, only 3 stars for shattering my idealistic view of the socially responsible Ben & Jerry's store that couldn't afford to stay open as is... that was the main reason I bought from there. For now, I prefer saving my $3.25 for a whole pint of B&J at the store vs. just a scoop in a cone.
author: Anika K.

description: Not only is the ice cream WAY over priced, starting at $5.00 for one scoop but the staff are AWFUL.  What kind of ice cream parlor doesn't allow children to use the bathroom? After spending over $11 bucks on ice cream my three year old should be able to use the toilet.  Not only did they say no but were rude.  Will never go back.  If you have kids find a better quality ice cream parlor.
author: Erika R.

description:
Everytime I go here, whatever I get always comes to $4.20.
Coincidence?
It's just so fitting...
author: Chrissy S.

description:
Pumpkin Cheesecake 
Pumpkin Cheesecake Pumpkin Cheesecake 
Pumpkin Cheesecake Pumpkin Cheesecake
Pumpkin Cheesecake Pumpkin Cheesecake Pumpkin Cheesecake
Pumpkin Cheesecake Pumpkin Cheesecake Pumpkin Cheesecake
Pumpkin Cheesecake Pumpkin Cheesecake Pumpkin Cheesecake

Did I mention that the Pumpkin Cheesecake Ice Cream is a spoonful of heaven?
author: D H.

description:
I have nothing against chains or heart attacks or delicious summer frozen treats.

This is a Ben and Jerry's. It has ice cream and some auxiliary treats like smoothies. On the pricey side. No seating.

I like it and I'm glad it's there but why it gets more than three stars is beyond me.
author: Jenny B.

description: The ice cream here is definitely overpriced.  Although service is good and fast, it does not make up for the price and so-so flavor.  I am a little disappointed, but I think I will return if I have a craving.
author: Miranda m.

description:
Ok, so I'll cop to the fact that I'm writing about a pint of B&J's that was purchased from a corner store, and not the actual Haight Street store - BUT, I've just had B&J half-baked frozen yogurt and I want to write about it. 

I was craving - CRAVING - ice cream to have tonight, while i snuggled under the 'lectric blanket, watching my new Netflix delivery of Six Feet Under.  Since I had no ice cream, I set out to the corner place to get some.  After much internal wrangling and a quick pinch of my extra belly, I decided to go for the Half-Baked Frozen Yogurt. 

What a mistake!  Yuck.  The texture is grainy, the flavor was bland, and just tasted like sugar.  The brownie and cookie dough bits were just tough pieces of sticky goo in the yogurt.  Terrible!    

And this episode of Six Feet Under isn't even that good.   Boo.
author: Jackie D.

description:
I'm not a big fan of their ice cream but one afternoon it dawned on me that I just HAD to have a huge sundae on a cone. As I waited in line, though I realized that the scooper must have been suffering some sort of withdrawal b/c he was shaking all over and could barely place a single scoop on a cone. But before I could turn around and leave, it was my turn and when prompted as to what I wanted, I blurted out ice cream sundae or whatever the heck that monstrous three scoop with nuts and chocolate syrup and whipped cream thing was called. 

Oh god, the next ten minutes was so horribly painful as the guy proceeded to shakily put this damn thing together. The manager kept murmuring reassuring words to him throughout the whole ordeal. When he was finally done, I was handed a drippy mess that leaked all over my hands and onto my shirt. 

But the scooper looked so darn happy with himself that I couldn't bear to say anything. I paid, left and hid behind a trashcan for a while to make sure he wasn't looking and threw the whole mess into the trashcan. I hope scooper man recovered successfully.
author: Nathalie L.

description:
I read somewhere that this place was some sort of community outreach thing to give underpriveledged kids a job or something.  I forget the details.

Anyway, I think the whole staff here is high.  Yea, I know it is Haight and that smell may be coming from outside, but they have to ask like 5 times to get your order correct, and it still takes 15 minutes for like, a shake.

I think it would be faster to drive to Maggie Mudd's or Naia and you'd end up with a better treat anyways.
author: Nessie V.

description: Yes I am sure that B&J's has done well in comparison to its super market brethren, but that doesn't really change the thrust of my criticism.  Among ice cream shops in the city, B&J's is the most expensive and has the worst product.
author: Luke M.

description:
I'd rather have a McDonald's soft serve, but the line was really long.

Decided to try B&J's since I was in the Haight.  My 'Half-Baked' fro-yo was so-so.  I was with a couple friends and wanted to pay for their items.  The guy behind the cashier said he couldn't help me - all I was asking for was to be rung up.  I had to wait a while until our last item was complete.  Maybe that's why my fro-yo was icy.
author: Cathy K.

description: Decent price, good ice cream! Workers are usually nice.
author: Alex L.

description:
I thought going to the ice cream store was supposed to be fun.

Our recent trip to BAJ on Haight was nothing close to fun thanks to the poor attitude of the "manager" who identified himself as Dan. We won't be patronizing this business and are encouraging others in our school to BEWARE.

On a hot Friday afternoon some parents of the newest public elementary school on Haight St.  (Chinese Immersion School at DeAvila) decided to treat our kids to some ice cream.  BAJ is only a block away so we ventured off, about six kids and five adults. 

When we arrived a visibly annoyed Dan, started serving us, seemingly upset that we were so many people all wanting ice cream and equally upset that we inquired if there were "children scoops" available. He admonished us to keep the kids off the short lip in front of the ice cream stations.  This lip is 18 inches off the ground and appeared to be a stepping perch for kids to view and select their ice cream.  

Apparently not, according to Dan. He admonished us and told the kids to get off of the "perch". Ok,  I was fine with that.

When he was asked to get a "regular" cone for one of the kids, he said we call them "cake cones",  to which I replied "I call them regular cones" to which he replied, "then I'll bring you the wrong cone", my reply "then I'll ask for another" then Dan said, "then I'll ask you to leave the store."

Ok,  if it were not for the fact that we had six kidergartners ready for their scoop of happiness,  I would have spun around and left right then.  But,  we were committed.

We purchased about $50-60 dollars of ice cream and pledged to each other never to return to this business and to furthermore tell all of the other parents at or new school of BAJ's unfriendly attitude towards the children and parents.

Note to Management:  Dan needs some re-training if he is  going to represent your business in the way it is promoted in advertisements ie: folksy, warm and friendly.  I'm sure he has a lot of difficult people to deal with on Haight St., but his attitude is losing money for your franchise.  We will go elsewhere.
author: Tom H.

description: More like a 3.5 because of the ordering set-up but whatevers, it was still very refreshing after eating indian food that left the after taste in our mouths.  Even though the day was cold it was still a good treat to cleanse the palette.  When we got in after 3pm it was very crowded with the line going up to the door.  There were also not that many workers actually helping the customers while there were a few coming in and out of the back not really do anything.  When it finally reached my turn I wanted the half baked but they didnt have it even though the tag was still there so i was quite dissapointed.  However, I just ordered the regular oatmeal raisin cookie ice cream on a cake cone and my scoop was REALLY generous.  But for $4.50 a scoop it better be =P.
author: Kristen C.

description:
Hey man...

Like, that's totally awesome dude.

Now, it was great to go to this location simply because it's near all the hippie-era stuff. Like, you totally imagine seeing people in beads and beards walking around, smoking mary jane and listening to Janice and Jimi.

Oh, and the ice cream here is kickin' like Jet Li

Totally dude. Totally.
author: Drew S.

description:
So the individual pints are probably cheaper than the ice cream in a cone, but the pints don't come with a delicious waffle cone, or hot cookies.

Every time I walk past this place, I'm so tempted to go in and eat everything.

The employees are always happy, which if you work in an ice cream shop how could you be grumpy, and there is this crazy dude that works there my roommates and I affectionately refer to as the "bee guy".

If you're looking for the hippie Haight experience, interacting with this guy is a must.  He has red dreadlocks, is a super friendly server, but he talks with an annunciated zzzz instead of s.  This guy is rad, and our favorite employee by far.
author: C B.

description:
Ice Cream is really good depending on which one you get.  You win some, you lose some....

I got the Strawberry Cheesecake, and I like the one at Baskin Robbins better.

Service was bad!!!!!!!

In short, if I buy Ben and Jerry's... I'm going to the grocery stores!
author: Michelle Y.

description: I know I'm gonna sound like a cheap skate, but seeing just under $5 for 1 scoop???!!!! I walked out. That's just insane.  I headed straight to the supermarket and bought a pint of Cherry Garcia for a few of us to share for the same price.
author: T. W.

description:
Okay, I have to admit... I really don't like Ben & Jerry's ice cream.  Never have. I used to get coupons for free scoops so I 've tried a ton of flavors, but there's just something about it... too rich or something.  I don't know.

Anyway, today was so friggin hot that I just HAD to have an ice cream shake.  I was complaining out loud that "there aren't any damn ice cream shops on Haight St." when my partner said, "Duh, Ben & Jerry's?"

So I went and got a shake.  It was made with coffee ice cream and it was okay.  Not thick enough for my tastes, but it did come with whipped cream on top.  The freakin' hippie that made it dropped the not-plastic-but-made-of-biodegradable-cornstarch cup on the ground and offered to wash it off before filling it with my shake.  Oh fer cryin out loud.  *Just throw the damned biodegradable thing in the garbage and give me a new one, ya friggin hippie!*
author: Lisa W.

description:
DEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEELISH.

well i love ice cream so........

expensive, but for a bj, its worth it.

How can things on the haight be so expensive when only bums live there?
author: kim w.

description: They r so nice :) will giv u two flavors in one cup if u ask and r always friendly
author: Jay W.

description: Terrible. Just terrible. The wait in this run down safety hazard of a store was almost unbearable as the staff appeared lazy and slow, not interested in moving customers forward at a more efficient pace. I inquired about the selection of flavors for a large serving in a cup, the shop clerk cheerfully said to me "you can have as maaaany flavors as you like for that size." I went for three flavors and she just put in an elevated price from the board. I asked why the price doesn't match the price on the board and she told me, in a manner like I should know better, that this was because I wanted an extra flavor. I said to her that it was nothing that was communicated to me and that it's strange to me after what she said in the beginning. She just shrugged her shoulders and said that there was nothing she could do. I must say, being part of a large corporation seems to mean that this brand no longer stands for anything but maximum profit. Triple flavor conclusion: Yikes, I wouldn't recommend this to anyone. Support nice, small independent ice makers in San Francisco, who care about their customers and care about their product by using only organic milk and cream for example. Nothing Ben & Jerry's does.
author: Ben U.

description:
Great place to indulge! 
Ice cream is fresh and the staff is cool.
Aaron P. does not agree here but as he is so wrong on many of his critiques, one wonders where his taste buds are located. Close to his brain center,  I suppose -which is right up his ass. Apearently there is a lot of other action there so he gets a little confused.....
author: Rou V.

description: The window advertised pumpkin cheesecake ice cream.  Which I got immediately.
author: David D.

description: Surprising! That's how I'd describe this place.... I've tried every ice cream place in the city, but avoided BnJ because it is a chain.  Have to say that was a mistake.  The ice cream here is surprisingly good.  Great flavor combinations, especially if you prefer chunks of stuff in your ice cream.  Staff was helpful in that funky Haight sort of way.
author: p w.

description: Damn you Fish Food!  Oh how I love you.  However when I made my first visit to an actual B&J shop I went with... well, I don't remember what it was called... but I think it had 42 different types of Chocolate, mixed with 4 types of Brownies, 8 types of chocolate chip cookie dough and was covered in Hot fudge, cold fudge, room temperature fudge, snickers, kit kats and hershies kisses... and it was good.  I don't see how the 98% fat free sign could be true on this one!
author: Jeff S.

description: I know how unsound it is to have lots of sugar on a long weekend, but then there are certain things in life you just need to indulge. And Ben & Jerry is one of them. I can't express how much I enjoy the less guilt Black Raspberry Low Fat Frozen Yogurt  topped with the luxurious butter pecan ice-cream in a super coconut chocolate ice-cream.
author: T L.

description: I had a regular Coffee Coffee Buzz Buzz Buzz and Sweet Cream & Cookies. Sweet Cream on the top. Both were tasty but I wish they were a littler harder. I like my ice cream on the hard side.
author: Amy D.

description:
I just had the most amazing experience there last weekend.  Had friends from out of town  (Iowa) with little kids.  We drove them all over the place and everyone was dragging.  

We were walking down Haight and their kids saw the ice cream store.  I hadn't been over to this part of the Haight in a while.  There is no price for a kids cone, but we asked and they gave our friend's kids a discounted price.  They were a little worried at first about Ben & Jerry's because of some nut allergies and the gentleman took out a separate new scoop and gave our kids a chocolate and vanilla cones which were really good.  I had Cherry Garcia and our friends both had New York Super Fudge and Cookie Dough.

Our friends are right wing Americans and although the whole scene of the Haight Ashbury was a bit of a shock to them.  Heck, the whole City was a shock to their senses, but before they left and after they got back, they called us and told us how cool it was to go to that ice cream store.  We have a neat photo of their family with some of the Haight Street characters surrounding them.

I'm not a big fan of caitalistic behavior on Haight St. but i would imagine the store has to charge more for this historic location, but when we were at Fisherman's Wharf I think they charged us more for ice cream there.  I think it is just the cost of living in San Francisco.
author: Al Y.

description: Took my "in laws" to H/A Ben and Jerry's thinking I was doing a good thing. Pops started to cry at the sight of Gap and B&J's in his childhood hometown. Gawd I had no idea he was a beatnik, hippie or whatever! He did not appreciate the offer of a waffle cone filled with Cherry Garcia so I ate it! Yummy. He also went nuts at the sight of one  long hair mid 50's guy wearing his Berks smoking a joint while using the ATM machine. Sorry I don't relate but it was funny all the same.
author: JayChan H.

description: Have you ever eaten Half Baked ice cream, while watching Half Baked, while being half-baked? Yeah, you know that sounds like the coolest thing ever.
author: Ali L.

description: Everyone loves ice cream, and everyone loves Haight St.  However, the two don't always live in harmony!  The tiny scoops of ice cream at Ben and Jerry's cost almost $4?  Come on!  This is against everything the hippies stood for.  On top of that, I didn't have cash, and you can only use a card for purchases of more than $4.  So I had to buy a can of soda as well.  Walking around on Haight St carrying an open can of soda and trying to eat my little scoop of ice cream was not fun.  It would be nice if they had more indoor tables, and bigger scoops of ice cream please!!
author: Laura W.

description: Don't even try to be cheap by just getting a pint at your local corner store - it's all about the waffle cone.
author: Maria D.

description: This is one of the only places open late on Haight St. when you're wandering there around 9 or 10 pm. I love their coconut macadamia ice cream in the waffle cone (god I love the smell of waffle cones). This is the best Ben and Jerry's in the city (DON'T GO TO THE MACY'S ONE)!!
author: O K.

description: So I went into Ben & Jerry's today to get one scoop in a cup for $4.  I attempted to pay with CASH... seems simple enough, right?  Well not really.  My cash was in the form of a $50 bill and the guy behind the counter refused to accept this form of payment because he said Ben and Jerry's doesn't accept $50 bills.  So he suggested that I pay with credit/debit... for which I would have had to add to my purchase in order to get to the minimum charge that Ben & Jerry's would accept.  NO THANKS!  The end result was I had to give back my ice cream and walk out VERY unsatisfied!!! Too bad because I am a really big fan of B&J but I don't  intend to go there again.
author: Brooke Z.

description: I went in wanting a scoop of chunky monkey just one scoop, all I had was a credit card, I was told I had to get moor to use the card, why is it you can not just get what you want or deed for the moment, is it o much to ask for a scoop now a days.
author: Ed S.

description:
Recently picked up an ice-cream cake ordered by my wife. I was charged $55 for it, and my mistake was not to query it at the time (but I'd been in line for 20 mins and had to get my son's birthday organized).

Anyway, I realized later that they overcharged by $12 (charged me for a larger cake). I called the manager, DAN, many, many times (more than 10) to try to work out a refund (hey, I would even have taken store credit). But he kept evading and said the store owner had to approve it. BTW, Dan, what do you manage, since you're never in the store and can't approve a $12 correction?

If their credit card machine wasn't "broken" I would have disputed the charge.

So, caveat emptor, check your charges, check your change and keep your receipt.

We've just ordered another birthday cake from Mitchell's --- take that, Haight Street B&J!!
author: paul g.

description: Admitedly, I have no sweet tooth. Put a salt lick in front of me and I'm all over it, but if ever there was a time to enjoy something sweet, it hits me as soon as the wafting smell of waffle cone reaches me.
author: E.Mo. ..

description: The staff can sure make a mean icecream sundae.
author: Kristen J.

description: This ice cream is sooo expensive and not so special (sorry).  Getting a cherry garcia on haight ashbury is pretty darn cool, though!
author: Lauren S.

description: Who doesn't love Ben and Jerry's??? Come on now... My only complaint about this particular Ben and Jerry's is that it's too small and almost always over crowded and half the time there's a line out the door...
author: Lindsey S.

description: I love Ben and I love Jerry, but together I love them even more!!  If this place ever closes I will be doomed, because there will be nothing to feed my ice cream addiction....  Plus having friends who work here always helps with the expensive addiction that I call ice cream mania...
author: Cassie L.

description:
Since when does 2 single scoops of ice cream  = $8+?

good ice cream, but what a rip off. 

boo ben. boo jerry.
author: Kay T.

description:
ben&jerry=my 2 bffs

1 half baked
2 magic brownie
3 peach cobbler
4 peanut butter cup
5 oatmeal raisin cookie
author: Kaylan S.

description: I prefer enjoying Ben & Jerry's ice cream away from the wafting odors of human feces and marijuana. There is something about those scents that turns me off of eating for some reason. I like it when you tip them and they ring a big ol cowbell as if you've just hit the jackpot though, that's nice.
author: Colleen B.

description: Ben & Jerry's isn't my favorite ice cream, but whenever I get a shake from here on a sunny day, it isn't too bad of a treat. The workers do seem like they are high in some way, but they're pretty chilled and relaxed. Though it takes a while to make my shake, its all good.
author: Edgar G.

description:
So I went here the other day with some children that I work with as a special treat for their somewhat decent behavior. Seeing as how these kids are usually prone to naughty behavior and somewhat lack social skills, I was quite nervous upon entering the ice cream shop. Luckily, the nicest guy in the world helped us and was so awesome that he offered 3 different flavors to each child and even threw in a few jokes and some info about the music that was playing in the background. Thats the good news. 
The bad news is that when a second group from my work arrived, Mr. Nice Guy ice cream man wasn't there anymore and my coworker and her group of kids had to be subjected to the rudeness and crankiness of the little man behind the counter. The register was broken and he seemed annoyed at everyone in there. Not only did that have to put up with his major 'tude, but they also "accidentally" gave one of the little kids coffee ice cream instead of chocolate chip cookie dough. Umm.. Oooopss! If you only knew Mr. Ice Cream man what we dealt with that night, if you only knew...
In conclusion, our experience was half good, half bad, and the ice cream was all good.
author: reina t.

description: I just love ice cream period.  Even on a cold day I can't refuse going in and buying a scoop with a chocolate covered pecan waffle cone.  This is a very small Ben and Jerry's store with an extremely nice staff!  LOVE IT!
author: Shane P.

description: How much do I hate myself for ordering "Half Baked" at Haight's Ben & Jerry's?
author: A W.

description:
the only fresh & frozen dessert I eat is a chocolate shake. no reason - just a comfortable place for me.

$6.50 & pretty good. comes with whipped cream.

so there you go - tres estrellas
author: Lawrence K.

description: let's face it: nobody beats these two looneys when it comes to smoking up interesting flavor combinations. it's kind of like a couple of fraternity boys grew up and went to cooking school. somebody pass the bowl...of ice cream, that is.
author: Kristina P.

description: It is very rare that I will eat ice cream (aka "frozen FAT").  But if I do, it is Ben and Jerry's.  They are very friendly here and have all the yummy flav's.
author: James B.

description: I had the Cherry Garcia in a freshly made waffle cone. Very good. Service was a little slow, but certainly nothing to get upset about. After all, you're in Haight/Ashbury, so don't be in a rush. Although the prices run a little high, the location is great.
author: merle s.

description: hmm good spot after eatin around haight and walkin around :)
author: Brad B.
